title: Celtics rookies Hugo Gonzalez and Amari Williams proved they can step up, play big minutes in NBA
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Celtics Williams woke up in Portland before finding out the Celtics needed him in Brooklyn Friday.
Hugo Gonzalez hit a huge three in Friday night's win.
(AP Photo/Mike Stewart) Hugo Gonzalez had been on the floor less than 10 minutes prior to the fourth quarter on Friday night.

title: The Patriots are back, and so are the old, miscast feelings of ESPN bias against the team
author: Chad Finn
bullets: New England Patriots The notion that the network has a disdain for the Patriots was a recurring claim during the two-decade dynasty, and has now returned in force.
Cam Newton, the flamboyant former Patriots quarterback, has voiced a lot of hot takes about his former club on ESPN shows this season.
Jacob Kupferman By Chad Finn January 24, 2026 | 5:09 PM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: 21 stats to know for Sunday’s Patriots-Broncos AFC Championship matchup
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The battle between the Patriots' offense and the Broncos' defense is a matchup of strength against strength.
Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel are looking to help the Patriots advance to their first Super Bowl in seven years.
(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) We know what the Patriots’ and Broncos’ strengths are ahead of Sunday’s AFC Championship Game.

title: Patriots set to welcome back WR Mack Hollins from IR for AFC title game
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Hollins has missed the last four games due to an abdominal injury.
Mack Hollins is set to return to the Patriots' lineup after missing the last four games.
(AP Photo/Nick Wass) The Patriots are getting a key contributor to their offense back for Sunday’s AFC Championship Game against the Broncos.

title: Why Mike Vrabel felt it was ‘my job’ to keep playing Rhamondre Stevenson after Patriots RB’s early fumbling woes
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots "Watching back from the film from before I got here, there was nobody who protected the quarterback or his teammates more than Rhamondre.
" Rhamondre Stevenson (left) has been a key contributor for the Patriots after Mike Vrabel stuck by him following his early-season fumbling woes.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) When Rhamondre Stevenson went through his fumbling struggles early in the regular season, Mike Vrabel felt he had a responsibility to let the Patriots running back play his way out of those mistakes based on his previous work.

title: NBA insider: Celtics going to be ‘aggressive’ on trade market, looking to possibly add a ‘big-time’ center
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Celtics Multiple reports have recently indicated that the Celtics could be buyers ahead of the Feb.
5 trade deadline.
Celtics president of basketball operations Brad Stevens could be set to make some more trades again.

title: ‘I’m worried about everyone else’: Sean Payton, Peyton Manning express confidence in Broncos QB Jarrett Stidham vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots "I'm not worried about Stiddy in this game.
" Jarrett Stidham will be making his first start in over two years in Sunday's AFC Championship Game.

(AP Photo/David Zalubowski) By Conor Roche January 24, 2026 | 11:05 AM 3 minutes to read Sean Payton wants to make it clear: He’s comfortable with Jarrett Stidham starting in place of injured Bo Nix at quarterback for the Broncos in Sunday’s AFC title game against the Patriots.

title: Sure, the Broncos don’t have their starting quarterback, but that doesn’t mean they’ve been left with nothing
author: Chad Finn
bullets: New England Patriots Many teams would be unable to handle an injury as devastating as that of Bo Nix so deep into the playoffs.
But the Broncos might be an exception.
The Broncos' defense, led by Nik Bonitto (15) and Zach Allen (99), ranked second in the NFL in yards allowed (278.

title: From New England lore to Netflix: ‘Secret Mall Apartment’ is streaming now
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Local News The documentary follows the story of the artists who lived in the Providence Place Mall.
We talked to artist Michael Townsend, who got arrested, got banned — and lived to tell the tale.
Secret Mall Apartment" director Jeremy Workman, right, poses with artist Michael Townsend at a replica of the hidden space Townsend and his friends once lived in at the Providence Place mall.

title: An Elliss family first: Brothers Christian (Patriots) and Jonah (Broncos) to go at in AFC Championship game
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots “I’m excited.
Excited for the opportunity to be able to play against him.
That’s not something that you get often.
